properties.Event: Barnabas and Saul sent as missionaries from Antioch of Syria. (Ac 13:1-3)
properties.Name: Antioch (of Syria)

properties.Event: Barnabas and Saul sail from Seleucia to Salamis in Cyprus; they proclaim the word of God in local synagogues (Ac 13:4-6)
In Paphos, Saul is for the first time on record called Paul (Ac 13:6, 9)  Sergius Paulus, proconsul of Cyprus, becomes a believer (Ac 13:7, 12)
properties.Name: Paphos

properties.Event: Paul and his companions arrive in Perga in Pamphylia; John Mark returns to Jerusalem (Ac 13:13)
properties.Name: Perga

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas travel back to Perga and proclaim the word; they go down to Attalia (Ac 14:24, 25)
properties.Name: Attalia

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas preach in the synagogue in Antioch of Pisidia (Ac 13:14-16) Many gather in Antioch to hear Paul and Barnabas, but the Jews persecute the two men (Ac 13:44, 45, 50)
properties.Name: Antioch (of Pisidia)

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas speak in the synagogue in Iconium; many Jews and Greeks become believers (Ac 14:1) Some Jews in Iconium oppose the brothers, and the city is divided; the Jews try to stone Paul and Barnabas (Ac 14:2-5)
properties.Name: Iconium

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas in Lystra, a city of Lycaonia; they are mistaken for gods (Ac 14:6-11) Jews who came from Antioch and Iconium fiercely oppose Paul in Lystra; Paul survives stoning (Ac 14:19, 20a)
properties.Name: Lystra

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas declare the good news in Derbe; quite a few become disciples (Ac 14:20b, 21a)
properties.Name: Derbe

properties.Event: Paul and Barnabas return to newly established congregations in Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch to strengthen them; they appoint elders in each congregation (Ac 14:21b-23)
From Attalia, they sail for Antioch of Syria (Ac 14:26, 27)
